name: gas
task_intro:
**Author**: Alexander Vergara  
**Source**: [UCI](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/gas+sensor+array+drift+dataset) · [OpenML](https://www.openml.org/d/1476)  
**Please cite**: Vergara, A., Vembu, S., Ayhan, T., Ryan, M. A., Homer, M. L., & Huerta, R. (2012). *Chemical gas sensor drift compensation using classifier ensembles*. Sensors and Actuators B: Chemical, 166–167, 320–329. doi:10.1016/j.snb.2012.01.074  

* Abstract:

This dataset contains 13,910 measurements collected from 16 chemical sensors during 36 months of operation. Each measurement represents a 128-dimensional feature vector derived from 8 features extracted per sensor. The task is to classify six different gases (Ethanol, Ethylene, Ammonia, Acetaldehyde, Acetone, and Toluene) based on sensor responses. The dataset is commonly used for studying drift compensation and long-term stability in gas sensor arrays.
target_description: Gas type label (1: Ethanol, 2: Ethylene, 3: Ammonia, 4: Acetaldehyde, 5: Acetone, 6: Toluene)
